channel.title: TORONTO STAR

item.title: ‘Do something!’ A looming abortion decision has overturned America’s political landscape
item.author: Edward Keenan - Washington Bureau Chief
item.description: It is suddenly probable that a right American women have considered assured by the Constitution for 50 years is about to be revoked, Edward Keenan writes.

media:content.media:title: ‘Do something!’ A looming abortion decision has overturned America’s political landscape
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators protest outside of the U.S. Supreme Court Tuesday, May 3, 2022 in Washington. A draft opinion suggests the U.S. Supreme Court could be poised to overturn the landmark 1973 Roe v. Wade case that legalized abortion nationwide, according to a Politico report released Monday.

item.title: Prosecutors charge 3 with murder in Sacramento mass shooting
item.author: Kathleen Ronayne And Stefanie Dazio - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Prosecutors charge 3 with murder in Sacramento mass shooting
media:content.media:description: A passerby pauses at a memorial for the people killed in mass shooting in Sacramento, Calif., April 6, 2022. Prosecutors have filed murder charges in a mass shooting that rocked California’s capital city a month ago. District Attorney Anne Marie Schubert said Tuesday, May 3, that three men have been charged with murder in the slayings.

media:content.media:title: Prosecutors charge 3 with murder in Sacramento mass shooting
media:content.media:description: Authorities search area of the scene of a mass shooting with multiple deaths in Sacramento, Calif., on April 3, 2022. Prosecutors have filed murder charges in the mass shooting that rocked California’s capital city a month ago. District Attorney Anne Marie Schubert said Tuesday, May 3, that three men have been charged with murder in the slayings.

item.title: Escaped inmate, jail official had ‘special relationship’
item.author: The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Escaped inmate, jail official had ‘special relationship’
media:content.media:description: This combination of photos provided by the U.S. Marshals Service and Lauderdale County Sheriff's Office in April 2022 shows Casey Cole White, left, and Assistant Director of Corrections Vicky White. On Saturday, April 30, 2022, the Lauderdale County Sheriff's Office said that Vicky White disappeared while escorting inmate Casey Cole White, being held on capital murder charges, in Florence, Ala.. The inmate is also missing. (U.S.
media:content.media:credit: Marshals Service, Lauderdale County Sheriff's Office

item.title: Brazil’s Senate to investigate after alleged Yanomami rape
item.author: Fabiano Maisonnave - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Brazil’s Senate to investigate after alleged Yanomami rape
media:content.media:description: An Indigenous man with the phrase painted on its back that reads in Portuguese "Mining Kills," participates in a protest against the increase of mining activities that are encroaching on his land, in front of the Ministry of Mines and Energy, in Brasilia, Brazil, Monday, April 11, 2022. A fast-expanding network of antennae is empowering Indigenous groups to use phones, video cameras and social media to galvanize the public and pressure authorities to respond swiftly to threats from gold miners, landgrabbers and loggers.

item.title: Court mulls ruling that blocked NC Rep. Cawthorn challenge

media:content.media:title: Court mulls ruling that blocked NC Rep. Cawthorn challenge
media:content.media:description: U.S. Rep. Madison Cawthorn, R-N.C., gets up from his wheelchair to speak before former President Donald Trump takes the stage at a rally, Saturday, April 9, 2022, in Selma, N.C.

item.author: Sean Murphy - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Oklahoma governor signs Texas-style ban on most abortions
media:content.media:description: El gobernador de Oklahoma Kevin Stitt en un evento el 12 de abril del 2022 en Oklahoma City.

item.title: Leaked court document galvanizes anti-abortion activists
item.author: David Crary - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Leaked court document galvanizes anti-abortion activists
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators protest outside of the U.S. Supreme Court Tuesday, May 3, 2022 in Washington. A draft opinion suggests the U.S. Supreme Court could be poised to overturn the landmark 1973 Roe v. Wade case that legalized abortion nationwide, according to a Politico report released Monday. Whatever the outcome, the Politico report represents an extremely rare breach of the court's secretive deliberation process, and on a case of surpassing importance.

media:content.media:title: Leaked court document galvanizes anti-abortion activists
media:content.media:description: Longtime anti-abortion activist Barbara Beavers, left, prays as she waits by the entrance to the Jackson Women's Health Organization (JWHO), Mississippi's last remaining abortion clinic parking lot, to hand out pro-life materials to an incoming patients, Tuesday, May 3, 2022, in Jackson, Miss. Clinic escorts stand on the other side of the entrance to direct and deflect any interference from anti-abortion protestors.

item.title: Man convicted in fatal stabbing of 11-year-old Houston boy
item.author: Juan A. Lozano - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Man convicted in fatal stabbing of 11-year-old Houston boy
media:content.media:description: Andre Jackson reacts after the jury found him guilty of the fatal 2016 stabbing of 11-year-old Josue Flores at the Harris County Criminal Courthouse, Tuesday, May 3, 2022, in Houston. (Godofredo A.

media:content.media:title: Man convicted in fatal stabbing of 11-year-old Houston boy
media:content.media:description: Josue Flores' family exits the Harris County Criminal Courthouse following the guilty verdict against Andre Jackson, Tuesday, May 3, 2022, in Houston. Jackson was found guilty by the jury of fatally stabbing 11-year-old Josue Flores in 2016. (Godofredo A.

item.title: Sudden abortion focus shakes midterm election landscape
item.author: Steve Peoples And Alan Fram - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Sudden abortion focus shakes midterm election landscape
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators protest outside of the U.S. Supreme Court Tuesday, May 3, 2022 in Washington. A draft opinion suggests the U.S. Supreme Court could be poised to overturn the landmark 1973 Roe v. Wade case that legalized abortion nationwide, according to a Politico report released Monday. Whatever the outcome, the Politico report represents an extremely rare breach of the court's secretive deliberation process, and on a case of surpassing importance.

media:content.media:title: Sudden abortion focus shakes midterm election landscape
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators protest outside of the U.S. Supreme Court Tuesday, May 3, 2022 in Washington. A draft opinion suggests the U.S. Supreme Court could be poised to overturn the landmark 1973 Roe v. Wade case that legalized abortion nationwide, according to a Politico report released Monday. Whatever the outcome, the Politico report represents an extremely rare breach of the court's secretive deliberation process, and on a case of surpassing importance.

item.title: Florida woman guilty in nightclub shooting that killed 2
item.author: The Associated Press

item.title: Baseball signed by Zelenskyy to be sold for Ukraine relief
item.author: Mark Pratt - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Baseball signed by Zelenskyy to be sold for Ukraine relief
media:content.media:description: This image provided by RR Auction shows a baseball signed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The official Rawlings Major League baseball is being sold by Randy Kaplan, the renowned collector of balls that have been signed by world leaders, with a portion of the proceeds going to war relief efforts in Ukraine, auctioneer RR Auction of Boston said Tuesday, May 3, 2022.

item.title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
item.author: Chinedu Asadu - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
media:content.media:description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, waves to the crowds upon arrival in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Tuesday, May 3, 2022. Guterres on Tuesday said the reintegration of extremist rebels who have defected from the jihadi Boko Haram group that has waged a decade-long insurgency against the West African nation is "the best thing we can do for peace.

media:content.media:title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
media:content.media:description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, waves to the crowds upon arrival in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Tuesday, May 3, 2022. Guterres said Tuesday the reintegration of extremist rebels who have defected from the jihadi Boko Haram group that has waged a decade-long insurgency against the West African nation is "the best thing we can do for peace.

media:content.media:title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
media:content.media:description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, right, arrives in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Tuesday, May 3, 2022. Guterres on Tuesday said the reintegration of extremist rebels who have defected from the jihadi Boko Haram group that has waged a decade-long insurgency against the West African nation is "the best thing we can do for peace.

media:content.media:title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
media:content.media:description: People dance for United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres upon his arrival in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Tuesday, May 3, 2022. Guterres on Tuesday said the reintegration of extremist rebels who have defected from the jihadi Boko Haram group that has waged a decade-long insurgency against the West African nation is "the best thing we can do for peace.

media:content.media:title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
media:content.media:description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, waves to the crowds upon arrival in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Tuesday, May 3, 2021. Guterres said Tuesday the reintegration of extremist rebels who have defected from the jihadi Boko Haram group that has waged a decade-long insurgency against the West African nation is "the best thing we can do for peace.

media:content.media:title: In Nigeria, UN chief welcomes reintegration of extremists
media:content.media:description: Women wait for United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' arrival in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Tuesday, May 3, 2022. Guterres on Tuesday said the reintegration of extremist rebels who have defected from the jihadi Boko Haram group that has waged a decade-long insurgency against the West African nation is "the best thing we can do for peace.

item.title: Norman Mineta, transportation secretary in 9/11 era, dies
item.author: Brian Witte And Terence Chea - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Norman Mineta, transportation secretary in 9/11 era, dies
media:content.media:description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Norm Mineta speaks during a news conference in Sacramento, Calif., on March 31, 2005. Mineta, who as federal transportation secretary ordered commercial flights grounded after the 9/11 terror attacks in 2001, died Tuesday, May 3, 2022. He was 90.

media:content.media:title: Norman Mineta, transportation secretary in 9/11 era, dies
media:content.media:description: Norm Mineta, former transportation and commerce secretary, attends his portrait unveiling ceremony at the National Portrait Gallery, in Washington on July 26, 2010. The portrait was painted by artist Everett Raymond Kinstler. Mineta, who as federal transportation secretary ordered commercial flights grounded after the 9/11 terror attacks in 2001, died Tuesday, May 3, 2022. He was 90.

item.title: Tennessee governor won’t release records on execution error
item.author: Travis Loller - The Associated Press

item.title: FACT FOCUS: Gaping holes in the claim of 2K ballot ‘mules’
item.author: Ali Swenson - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: FACT FOCUS: Gaping holes in the claim of 2K ballot ‘mules’
media:content.media:description: A person drops off a mail-in ballot at an election ballot return box in Willow Grove, Pa., Oct. 25, 2021. On Tuesday, May 3, 2022, The Associated Press reported on a film that used a flawed analysis of cellphone location data and ballot drop box surveillance footage to cast doubt on the results of the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Defense leaders say Russia learning from mistakes in Ukraine
item.author: Lolita C. Baldor - The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Defense leaders say Russia learning from mistakes in Ukraine
media:content.media:description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley, right, and Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin testify to the Senate Appropriations Committee Subcommittee on Defense, Tuesday, May 3, 2022 on Capitol Hill in Washington.
media:content.media:credit: The Washington Post via AP, Pool

media:content.media:title: Defense leaders say Russia learning from mistakes in Ukraine
media:content.media:description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin testifies at a Senate appropriations hearing in the defense subcommittee on Capitol Hill in Washington, Tuesday, May 3, 2022.

media:content.media:title: Defense leaders say Russia learning from mistakes in Ukraine
media:content.media:description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley, right, and Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin testify before the Senate Appropriations Committee Subcommittee on Defense, Tuesday, May 3, 2022 on Capitol Hill in Washington.
